data.message: Any way to prevent the constant change of my news feed from "most recent" to "top stories"?? This summer I tried following some local groups for emergency/fire info, and missed several important posts due to this involuntary change.

replies.message: Hey Doug. If you feel you’re missing stories from a Page you’d like to see, go to the Page and confirm it says Following at the top. You can also adjust your News Feed to make posts from certain Pages appear at the top by selecting the prioritize who to see first option from your News Feed preferences. Learn more: http://bit.ly/2dMPI7n. -Jessica

Facebook That shouldn't be necessary.  If we choose to have our feeds set to "most recent" then that is how we should be able to view them.  I have changed my setting from "top stories" to "most recent" no fewer than 8 times today.  This is ridiculous.  How would FB know what I consider to be a "top story"?
It would be great if the date and time could be put on private messages
fb can you see my messages (messenger) for you? Please help me ..
Senoncadttillo paratodo lo amigo ke leciguen
